results.title: The Repco-Brabham story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Production
results.brief_description: Briefly shows manufacture and testing of racing cars by the Brabham Racing Organisation in England, followed by views of the 1965 Tasman Series motor races in Australia and New Zealand, Jack Brabham and others competing in Brabham cars. Finally, manufacture of a new Repco engine in Australia is shown.
results.description: Briefly shows manufacture and testing of racing cars by the Brabham Racing Organisation in England, followed by views of the 1965 Tasman Series motor races in Australia and New Zealand, Jack Brabham and others competing in Brabham cars. results.title: Half a Chance
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash, Film Victoria and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A collection of dramatised case studies of young offenders on probation. Both the probationer and the probation officer talk about the problems and advantages of this type of supervision.

results.title: All that is solid
results.brief_description: This is a speculative documentary on the subject of the future of Australia. It is conceived as a series of competing discourses with visionaries, politicians, media commentators and others, who are variously optimistic and pessimistic. Interviews are interspersed with symbolic, imaginative drama.

results.title: Two Girls and a Baby
results.creator_credit: Kelli Simpson, Penny Robins and Annamax Media
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the IVF process from the point of view of a lesbian couple as they deal with sperm banks, relationships, baby clothes, and community resistance.

results.title: [Black Knight]
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of the British “Black Knight” rocket test vehicle and its use in high speed flight and ballistic missile research. The elements of construction, ground support equipment, propulsion, guidance and instrumentation are discussed. Tests and launching preparations at Australia’s Woomera Range follow, closing with a night-firing sequence. NB: No opening or closing credits

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: Swiss Society for Combating Cancer and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: Women breakout
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis and Halfway House Collective
results.brief_description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. The film does not so much focus on the circumstances that led them to the Halfway House, rather it shows the house giving them support to take control of and change their lives.

results.title: Ship No. 76
results.brief_description: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.

results.title: First aid
results.brief_description: A film of historic interest: an official training film produced for the War department in three parts. Part 1: emergency treatment of bleeding wounds, including self-administration. Covers the arterial system, pressure points and application of tournequets. Part 2: emergency treatment of broken bones. Part 3: covers methods of removing the wounded.
